perturbation.original_text: The Company shall provide the Repairer not later than the tenth (10t h) Day of each Month with an activity report relating to each Aircraft and each Main Element serial number, and containing at least FH and Cycles performed during the preceding Month, the TSN, CSN, TSO, CSO, and the removals/installations events during such Month
perturbation.changed_text: The Company shall provide the Repairer not later than the thirtieth (30th) Day of each Quarter with an activity report relating to each Aircraft and each Main Element serial number, and containing at least FH and Cycles performed during the preceding Quarter, the TSN, CSN, TSO, CSO, and the removals/installations events during such Quarter.
perturbation.explanation: This modification delays the frequency of activity reports, which could violate regulations requiring timely and frequent reporting of aircraft maintenance data. For instance, FAA regulations in the United States mandate specific reporting timelines for maintenance-related data to ensure safety and compliance.
perturbation.contradicted_law: FAA regulations regarding aircraft maintenance reporting timelines

perturbation.original_text: In respect of all of the above insurances to contain breach or warranty provisions and confirmation the policies shall not be cancelled or materially changed without [*****] prior written notice [*****] or such lesser period in respect of War and Allied Peril).
perturbation.changed_text: In respect of all of the above insurances to contain breach or warranty provisions and confirmation the policies shall not be cancelled or materially changed without 1 day prior written notice or such lesser period in respect of War and Allied Peril).
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the notice period for insurance policy changes to just one day introduces a significant risk of non-compliance with standard aviation insurance practices and legal requirements. Insurance providers typically require a more extended notice period (often 30 days or more) to allow for adequate risk assessment and policy adjustments. This modification could violate contractual obligations with insurance carriers and potentially breach aviation regulations related to adequate insurance coverage.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Standard aviation insurance practices; potential breach of contract with insurance carriers

perturbation.original_text: Any invoice disputed by the Company shall have to be issued by Notice duly documented to the Repairer within [*****] from the date of its issuance. For the sake of clarity, the undisputed portion of such invoice shall be paid pursuant to this Agreement. Any invoice not disputed by the Company within said [*****] period, shall be deemed to be accepted by the Company.
perturbation.changed_text: Any invoice disputed by the Company shall have to be issued by Notice duly documented to the Repairer within 5 days from the date of its issuance. For the sake of clarity, the undisputed portion of such invoice shall be paid pursuant to this Agreement. Any invoice not disputed by the Company within said 5 days period, shall be deemed to be accepted by the Company.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the invoice dispute period to 5 days may violate standard business practices and legal expectations, which typically allow for a more reasonable timeframe (often 15-30 days) for reviewing and disputing invoices. This modification could be seen as an unfair business practice, especially in international transactions, and may not be enforceable under applicable contract law principles.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Standard business practices; contract law principles related to reasonable notice
